title: 4 capacitors set - remaining charge at time 3RC

content.question: There is an initial charge of magnitude <math alttext="100 microcoulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi><mtext>C</mtext></math> on each plate of capacitor <math alttext="C sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, Switch <math alttext="S sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mtext>S</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is opened and Switch <math alttext="S sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mtext>S</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is closed. If the combination of four capacitors in the circuit has an equivalent capacitance <math alttext="C sub equivalent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>C</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub></math>, what is the charge magnitude on each plate of capacitor <math alttext="C sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> at time <math alttext="t equals, 3 R C sub equivalent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi><msub><mi>C</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub></math>?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
